subject: Sales
title: The One-Sentence Pitch
description: A 60-second lesson on The One-Sentence Pitch.

hook.text: Pixar pitches entire movies in one line: 'A rat dreams of becoming a French chef.' Can you match that?

buildup.text: The one-sentence pitch distills your entire value proposition into a single memorable statement.

discovery.text: The formula: someone wants something but faces an obstacle, so they use your solution. Complete.

twist.text: If it takes more than a sentence, the message isn't clear yet. Simplicity demands the deepest thinking.

climax.text: Write your pitch. Cut it shorter. Cut it again. The shortest version that still works is the real one.

punchline.text: If it takes more than a sentence, it's not clear yet.

quiz.question: Why is a one-sentence pitch so powerful?
